reasoning: ML Model Scores: Ensemble score is 0.0% with individual Random Forest (29.9%) and XGBoost (30.5%) well below fraud thresholds.
Customer Profile: No prior escalations or fraud counts (escalate_count=0), clean transaction history.
Field Consistency: Numeric amount (USD 925.00) matches expectations; no conflicting numeric vs. written amount detected (written amount missing—not inherently suspicious but requires verification).
Document Authenticity: Valid issuer (MoneyGram), valid‐format serial number, signature field present.
Training Patterns: Although 45% of fraud cases involve amount mismatches, here there is no detected mismatch in numeric fields; missing written amount is noted but not decisive.

actionable_recommendations: Ask the teller to view and copy the purchaser’s government-issued photo ID
Physically inspect the money order for MoneyGram security features (watermark, color‐shifting ink)
Call MoneyGram’s verification hotline to confirm serial number validity
